text: Joseph Gerard Roger Plamondon (January 5, 1924 – January 26, 2019) was a Canadian professional ice hockey player. He played 74 games in the National Hockey League with the Montreal Canadiens. He was born in Sherbrooke, Quebec. He won the Stanley Cup in 1946. Plamondon was the last surviving member of Canadiens 1946 Stanley Cup team. Plamondon died on January 26, 2019 in Sherbrooke at the age of 95.Les Canadiens en deuil suite au décès de Gerry Plamondon ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey players Category:Cincinnati Mohawks (AHL) players Category:Montreal Canadiens players Category:Pittsburgh Hornets players Category:Sportspeople from Quebec
title: Gerry Plamondon
